title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is >.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. \\n $$y>\frac{1}{2} x-\frac{5}{2}$$ \\n $$0>0\frac{1}{2}-\frac{5}{2}$$ \\n $$0>\frac{-5}{2}$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y<\frac{1}{2} x-\frac{5}{2}$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, we shade the left side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph Second Inequality
text: Graph $$y>-4$$ on the same grid. Recognize that it is a horizontal line through $$y=-4$$.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is >.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. \\n $$y>-4$$ \\n $$0>-4$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y>-4$$. Since (0,0) is on the top side of the line, so we shade in the top side of the line $$y=-4$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
